summary: The Righteous Brothers are an American music duo, originally made up of Bill Medley and Bobby Hatfield. They started as a group called the Paramours in the 1960s and later became a duo, adopting the name "The Righteous Brothers." Their music was known as "blue-eyed soul." The duo had big hits like "You've Lost That Lovin' Feelin'" and "Unchained Melody." After Hatfield's death in 2003, Medley continued the group with a new partner, Bucky Heard. They were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2003 and are considered one of the greatest duos of all time.
title: The Righteous Brothers
